page.title: 03MRS ALLEN-L.OAKLEY-INTERVIEW
page.content: Mrs Allen has lived in LITTLE OAKLEY for 78 years and is now 81. " There once was a bridge and a ford,but 20 years ago the bridge was made flat,and the ford was drained and fenced.Also there was a spring with a stone hand with a hole in it where the children would drink from.There used to be a beer house and every Sunday men would come for miles to have a drink.There was once a school, but it was closed down when there weren't enough children in the village.The main celebrations were May Day and the coronation of King George and Queen Mary.On May Day the children would parade through the village carrying a basket decorated with flowers.On the coronation the villagers would join together in a barn and have a party" (cont.P4)
